subject: Re: [junit] TestNG 4 and Data Providers
msgSnippet: ... I know, I know, but it is possible that file already overwritten or can t be accessed. :-) ... Great! :-) I am just trying to make a point that common
messageBody:
CÃ©dric Beust ? wrote:

>>Besides, if the test failed on build or continuous integratino server you would have to rerun test locally with your breakpoint, which would
>>be quite waste of time in my opinion, because you should know that is
>>failed from the report.
>>
>>
>Actually, TestNG automates that since it generates a testng-failed.xml which
>you can then feed to TestNG to rerun only those tests that failed.
>
>
I know, I know, but it is possible that file already overwritten or
can't be accessed. :-)

>Okay. I'm not ruling data provider names out, I just decided to start simple
>and see what users will do with this feature and find out if it's really
>going to be an issue or not.
>
>
Great! :-)

I am just trying to make a point that common interface like Iterator
does not really fit in here because it can't be used to encapsulate
test-specific data and/or extend it in the future.

regards,
Eugene




[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
